instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1707: What is A1707? A1707 is a model number for a 15 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Late 2016, Mid 2017 with EMC 3072, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00281, 820-00928..
definitions.820-00281: What is 820-00281? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.CD3215: What is CD3215? This is a USB-C muxing chip responsible for USB-C communication with devices such as the laptop charger. The most common issue this chip is involved in is when a Macbook wonâ€™t charge or the charger is stuck at 5v instead of going to 20v..

threads.title: MacBook Pro 15 inches <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> stuck of 5V
threads.message:
Good day

I have a MacBook pro 15 inches <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> (<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>) stuck on 5V. One of the ports stays steady on 5V, while the other 3 ports are fluctuating, which I thought suggests the one that is stuck on 5V is the issue, hence the reason why I replaced it 3 times with 3 different known working <CHIP>CD3215</CHIP>, but still no changes, please advise, thank you.

threads.title: MacBook Pro 15 inches <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> stuck of 5V
threads.message: Compare diode mode readings between all <CHIP>CD3215</CHIP> chips.
